image.altText: Hundreds of people gather outside a hospital between ambulances

props.synopsis: Lebanon's Health Ministry says a child is among those killed by a wave of exploding pagers which the militant group Hezbollah uses to communicate.

title.children: At least nine killed, thousands injured after Hezbollah pagers explode across Lebanon

image.altText: A man is led out of a house in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: An Australian man has been arrested and charged over allegedly running an encrypted communications network tailored specifically for the use of criminal organisations.

title.children: Ghost, global organised crime, the alleged Australian administrator and how the AFP unravelled it

image.altText: Kitchen bench top

props.synopsis: Australia is the first country to prohibit fake stone, as the final step in a national crackdown on the deadly dust disease silicosis.

title.children: Fake kitchen stone to be stopped at border from January 1

image.altText: A silhouetted hand holding an iPhone with the Instagram logo on it

props.synopsis: Instagram is introducing automatic "teen accounts" for underage users from today in Australia, the US, the UK and Canada, limiting the content available to people aged under 18.

title.children: Instagram reveals tough new restrictions for underage users

image.altText: A composite of two white men wearing suits. One is older, with glasses and a tie. One is younger with no tie or glasses.

props.synopsis: Labor senators accuse the Coalition and Greens of using "procedural tricks" to avoid being forced to formally record their opposition to the Help to Buy initiative.

title.children: Labor's housing policy was likely to be voted down — until they couldn't bring on the vote

image.altText: Chinese fighter jet releases flares to intercept RAAF plane

props.synopsis: The 2022 incident involved a People's Liberation Army aircraft firing flares near the RAAF plane, before cutting in front of it and releasing "chaff" into its flight path.

title.children: Video emerges appearing to show 'dangerous' Chinese intercept of 'enemy' Australian aircraft

image.altText: A large crowd of people, including some holding a large banner saying 'Thank You Glasgow'

props.synopsis: The Scottish Government announces its support for a proposal that would give the ailing event a lifeline, as its revealed Commonwealth Games Australia will help foot the bill and chip in around $4.5 million.

title.children: Glasgow to host 2026 Commonwealth Games Victoria pulled out of, after 'generous' contribution from Australia

image.altText: Sean Combs, wearing a black jacket, looks neutrally off camera in front of plastered logos.

props.synopsis: The charges against the high-profile hip-hop mogul come after a number of other lawsuits accusing him of physical and sexual abuse.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs charged with sex trafficking and racketeering in United States

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: Productivity Commission chair Danielle Wood says she welcomes concessions made by the Albanese government to put clearer scrutiny of proposals for industry assistance into its Future Made in Australia legislation.

title.children: Productivity Commission welcomes additional scrutiny of Future Made in Australia projects

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits at her home computer.

props.synopsis: Tech giants have split over WFH rights, with many Australian businesses adopting hybrid approaches to when and how people need to attend work.

title.children: Amazon orders all workers back into office as some Australian companies embrace flexibility

image.altText: A court sketch of Ryan W. Routh, suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The suspect in an apparent assassination attempt on Donald Trump has appeared in court. This is what we learned from Mr Routh's first court appearance, documents provided to the court, and what could happen next.

title.children: What the court documents tell us about the apparent second attempt on Trump's life

image.altText: A young boy in burns wraps in hospital walking.

props.synopsis: An expert in international law says unless the alleged offender hands himself in, it's unlikely he will face a Queensland court anytime soon.

title.children: Extraditing the foreign national who allegedly attacked a Brisbane baby with hot coffee may prove challenging

image.altText: A green and beige camouflaged helicopter sits in shallow water at daybreak at a beach.

props.synopsis: A Defence air safety investigation has confirmed an Army Taipan helicopter was flying without recommended modifications to its engine before it crashed off the NSW coast in March last year.

title.children: Army failed to replace faulty engine in MRH-90 Taipan helicopter before crash

image.altText: A sculpture of a face and head with red lips and the skill absent showing the outline of a brain

props.synopsis: Many of the risk factors for dementia – being female, growing older and the genetic lottery — cannot be avoided. But research is uncovering a growing list of ways to cut your risk.

title.children: With dementia cases set to triple by 2050 in our region, there are 14 risk factors to watch for

image.altText: Gisele Pelicot speaks to a bank of microphones wearing round, brown sunglasses with people standing behind her looking on

props.synopsis: Dominique Pelicot's testimony is set to be key for the other 50 men accused of raping his then wife over nearly a decade.

title.children: A French man admits in court to drugging his wife so that he and dozens of men could rape her

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch and Elena Zhukova Murdoch hold hands as they walk away from a car.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch, his feuding sons and their sisters travel to Nevada for a court hearing over the future of the family's media empire.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch's bitter family feud plays out in small Nevada court

image.altText: An older woman is held by two men, standing in a garden

props.synopsis: An inquest into the death of Tammy Shipley, who died in custody at a NSW prison in 2022, has included CCTV footage of the final minutes before her death.

title.children: Woman who died in custody after $23.10 theft remembered as 'absolutely loving mother' by family

image.altText: Justin Stevens

props.synopsis: ABC news director Justin Steven says Australia needs a media sector "at the top of its collective game" as he calls out media infighting that could erode "public perception of all news and journalism".

title.children: ABC news director says increasingly 'toxic media environment' erodes public perception of journalism

image.altText: A red, white and blue logo in the shape of a Australian Rules football oval, featuring the letters "AFL".

props.synopsis: The AFL and AFLW 'soft' salary caps will both be increased over the next three years after the league announces multiple changes to the policy.

title.children: AFL increases salary caps for men's and women's competitions

image.altText: A collage of Bluesfest acts

props.synopsis: Music festivals in NSW are being offered a financial assistance as the state government scrambles to save the industry from extinction, but the director of Bluesfest says it may not be enough.

title.children: Bluesfest says government lifeline for festivals 'not the sort of investment we need'

image.altText: A composite image of newspaper clippings following the disappearance of Amber Haigh.

props.synopsis: When the young woman vanished, police stumbled across what they believed to be a sinister plot to take her baby boy. But despite a lengthy murder trial, what happened to her remains one of regional Australia's enduring mysteries.

title.children: Allegations of forced surrogacies, tied-up schoolgirls: How Amber Haigh's disappearance brought ominous rumours into the limelight

image.altText: Composite image of Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The Russian and Chinese economies are lurching into ever more perilous territory, threatening the nations' alliance.

title.children: Isolated on the world stage, Russia turned to China. Now it's suffering from a power imbalance

image.altText: OceanGate Titan submersible floating at the surface of the ocean

props.synopsis: A coastguard hearing into the death of five people on the Titan submersible is told the crew reported being "all good here" in the lead-up to the implosion during a dive to the Titanic.

title.children: Titan crew reported being 'all good here' before disaster

image.altText: Young Indian woman wearing a grey shirt.

props.synopsis: Indian students make up the second-largest group of international students in Australia, but opportunistic agents are scamming students out of hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title.children: Scores of Indian families fall victim to multi-million-dollar Australian visa fraud

image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: A former public servant who was paid hundreds of thousands of dollars in kickbacks to award lucrative contracts to his associates is sentenced to more than four years' jail.

title.children: Disgraced cash-for-contracts public servant jailed for 'gross' abuse of power

image.altText: Celery plants growing in a vegetable garden.

props.synopsis: Imagine working for a year and only being paid 10 weeks' pay. This is what happened to a migrant worker at Australia's largest celery farm.

title.children: Migrant workers at celery farm left frightened after company's 'complete failure' to pay wages

image.altText: Senate House of Reps generic composite

props.synopsis: Welcome to that time of the political cycle where we find ourselves burrowing into the election date speculation rabbit hole.

title.children: Could we have a double dissolution election on the Australia Day weekend? Technically yes, but probably no

image.altText: A close up of a penguin with a yellow eye and feathers, orange spotted beak and white and black body

props.synopsis: The notoriously shy yellow-eyed bird edged out other New Zealand birds to win the annual competition designed to raise awareness of threatened species.

title.children: 'Noise shouter' hoiho penguin wins NZ Bird of the Year

image.altText: A man in a suit stares at the camera.

props.synopsis: In July, the government appointed an anti-Semitism envoy and announced an Islamophobia equivalent would soon follow. Ten weeks on, the Islamophobia position remains vacant.

title.children: 'Almost farcical': Two months after the anti-Semitism envoy was appointed, there is still no Islamophobia envoy

image.altText: Trade Minister Don Farrell and UAE Trade Minister Thani bin Ahmed Al Zeyoudi.

props.synopsis: The federal government is predicting a flood of new investment into Australia's critical mineral and clean energy sectors after sealing a free trade pact with the United Arab Emirates.

title.children: Government expecting investment into critical minerals and clean energy after trade pact with UAE

image.altText: Melbourne Metro city loop train

props.synopsis: Few cities in the world could be classified as a 15-minute city, according to new international research.

title.children: Europe doing better at creating 15-minute cities than Australia, research finds

image.altText: A man with a grey beard being interviewed by the press

props.synopsis: Philip Nordfelt tells the coronial inquest into the 21-year-old's 2010 death that he did not bump and injure Mr Warneke with his vehicle.

title.children: Former taxi driver denies hitting Josh Warneke on the night he died in Broome

image.altText: Firefighters stand outside on a street near fire trucks.

props.synopsis: ACT police say a house fire in Spence, where one person was found dead, has been deemed suspicious.

title.children: Person found dead in Canberra house after 'suspicious' fire

image.altText: a photo of CCTV showing a woman sitting on pavement

props.synopsis: A woman has been flown to Royal Darwin Hospital in a critical condition after a man allegedly attacked her with an "edged weapon" in an alleged domestic violence-related assault outside a Katherine shopping centre.

title.children: Woman in critical condition after alleged domestic violence-related attack in NT town
